conclusion: A change in magnetic flux through the square frame – hence an induced current – only occurs while different parts of the loop are inside and outside the field.
The change in magnetic flux happens twice: while the loop is entering the field and while the loop is leaving the field.
Each stage lasts for the time it takes the loop to travel a distance equal to its own side length l.
With a constant speed v, the time for one stage is l / v.
The total time during which an induced current exists is the sum of both stages: t = l / v + l / v = 2l / v.
Time with induced current: t = 2l / v.
